sentence.text: Biallelic mutations in the protein dephosphorylation gene have been identified in one family with demyelinating Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease (CMT4B3) and two families with axonal neuropathy and additional neurological and skeletal features.

Here we describe novel sequence variants in protein dephosphorylation (c.1168CAAAAG and c.2209_2210del) as the potential causative mutations in two siblings with severe axonal neuropathy, hearing loss, facial weakness and bulbar features.
Our findings suggest that protein dephosphorylation mutations may cause a syndromic form of autosomal recessive axonal neuropathy (AR-CMT2) in addition to CMT4B3
